alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 11:44PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN GLYNN...NORTHEASTERN BRANTLEY AND SOUTHEASTERN WAYNE COUNTIES THROUGH 1230 AM EDT... At 1144 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Jesup to 9 miles northwest of Thalmann to near Raybon. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Gardi, Thalmann, Everett, Raybon, Mount Pleasant, Hortense, and Broadhurst. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
